Foxfingers could see that Dinobot was in good hands (Claws, hooks, whatever
Tavatrons apendages are.) he couldn't help but to remember his old life.
This bot before him was a true warrior, full of pride honor, and the
pigheadedness to get results. A bot of raw power but with the gentle
qualities that would make him a good friend. He almost gave his life to save
a fellow Maximal.

 The thief questioned his own convictions, would he be willing to give up
his reason for living for Veratis or Lady Hawk? he already knew the answer.
Once again he thought about the past. On his final days on Cybertron he'd
sold out his unit for payment. Unfortunately the Predacon in charge decided
to give him exactly what he deserved. Luckily Foxfingers escaped with only a
scarred emblem which he wore with shame. Veratis found him and had use for
his unique skills so they formed an agreement which has held true to this
very day.


----- Original Message -----
From: Carnage darkness <carnage_blood@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, October 04, 2000 5:05 PM
Subject: Enter.




** Dinobot watched Tavatron carefully out of the corner of his eye as he
continued towards the Cybertronian Fire, wondering just what thought
occupied her mind at the time to make her expression as concentrated as it
seemed at the moment.
However, he knew that her concerns and thought would eventually come to the
surface, or perhaps remain to herself. Either way was just fine with him.
His injuries were more placed upon his mind then the thoughts of a fembot
that he just managed to become his friend.
It concerned him that in the split second he transformed into Robot Mode he
would be in stasis lock, and with the lack of mech-fluid he doubted that a
simple CR chamber would fix such damage.
But he refused to enter a chamber in Beast Mode, never liking the slaging
CRs anyway.
Dinobot knew for a common fact that his systems would heal far better under
the reconstructive care of his own repair system, rather then the
synthetically reconfigured programs of the CR chambers.
However, his repair system required a certain amount of mech-fluid to
function, which he was below that limit, and which meant that he would have
to have fluids manually forced into his body until his remaining fluid cells
began producing more of themselves. And that would continue until his repair
systems activated and took over.
In simple, without at least 20% of mech-fluid in his body his repair systems
wouldn't activate.
Actually, in truth, he was surprised that he was functioning at all, with
such loose of fluids.
Dinobot looked off towards the distance for a moment, the sun now
three-quarters over the horizon to the Far East.
The beginning of the new day, and the end of his.
By now the reptilian warrior was rather tired, and the loose of fluid was
only contributing to it.
He glanced off to his side as Tavatron came up and fell into step beside,
his sight getting a little blurry from fatigue he was experiencing.
Dinobot growled as he neared the doors of the CF, the relief of completing
his mission was rather more then he expected.
And he knew exactly what he would do to celebrate.sleep.
If there was anything he wanted to do more in the world at the moment, it
was to simply curl up under a heat vent and sleep.
But it had been a rough 48 hours for him, and it was plainly obvious that he
deserved at least a mega-cycle of rest.
Dinobot approached the CF doors, hearing Tavatron's words more clearly then
day.
So, she knew of his dilemma.or at least enough of it to know that he didn't
exactly want to be here.
However, he was here and there was nothing he could do about it. And he'd
noticed that each day he accepted that face more and more, even though he
may not know it.
But he had still been cheated the heroes death he had rightfully earned and
had always strode for, cheated and sent back to this place to finish what he
helped create.the Beast Wars.
And he knew, even though he tried not to think about it, that such a noble
death was not likely to occur twice.
However, even though he would willingly invite death if the proper situation
ever arose again, he also had this unmistakable urge to live as well. To
keep his spark intact and connected with this shell of a body.
Yes, he would die when the time came, but until then or until this war was
over, he would ensure that he remained active and able to fight this war out
to the bitter end.
And he had to admit, seeing the Beast Wars finally over and done with would
be rather satisfying.
Though, he still doubted that he could ever return to Cybertron, not with
the criminal record he held over his head.
Just because he had died did not mean that it was all over, and the factor
that he had been brought back to life from reasons unknown only made him
more aware that if he returned, even in this different body, that he had the
same chance of being prosecuted as before.
So, indeed there was much to think about and do while this war was under
way, including settling with the uncomfortable memories of the past.
And his cheated death.
Again, such of the thought of his betrayal brought a rough growl to his
transmetal fangs.
And with those thoughts.he answered.**

" It is MUCH more then it seems. However, I doubt you could ever come to
know."

** And that was all he spoke on the subject, for, if Tavatron wanted a
further understanding of his predicament all she had to do was look up his
file.
It would clearly state his theft of the Golden Disk, his betrayal of
Megatron, his services and actions while fighting along side the Maximal
forces, and his heroic death.
He knew, he had looked at it himself.and filled in a few details that who
ever wrote it had not entered.
Dinobot walked up to the door of the Cybertronian Fire and looked it over
once, actually fairly impressed by the way this ship had been built.
Obvious it was a great advantage in this war, and it had probably proved
that while he and Tavatron had been away.
And it had been a while as well, only getting back now and seeing just how
much things had changed.
New ship, probably a new commander, and a fair amount of new soldiers.
Dinobot looked up at the doors one last time before the lifted and he
entered, his remaining functioning optic having a little trouble adjusting
to the artificial light.
It was like entering into a dark cave for a moment before it all came into
view, but even the light of the ship suddenly made him feel uneasy.
He had spent weeks out in the open, where he liked it the best, and now he
was closed in my tones of reinforced armor and manufactured environments.
It wasn't difficult to feel uncomfortable in an atmosphere such as this, but
he needed to be there.
For, it was either that or lay twitching on the ground later on from loose
of mech-fluid.
Besides, he was already feeling the effects of such a loose, nausea,
lightheadedness, difficulty breathing, and a slowness that just happened to
be creeping up on him.
Dinobot took in a deep breath and cringed as he felt his metallic lungs
expand, but then felt something slowly working its' way up his throat as
well.
Of course, he didn't know that the sudden expanding of his lungs from that
breath had punctured them slightly against a shred of his own armor that he
had failed to remove, sending mech-fluid slowly trickling into them and up
into his throat.
But he did notice just what had happened when mech-fluid slowly began to
drip from between his closed fangs, and when he breathed in there was a
rather wet sound to it.
He stopped and looked down, seeing the drops of fluid splattering against
the ground below, wondering just how in the Pit he had enough mech-fluid
left to bleed like this.
But there was also a pressure in his chest, which could only be the
remaining fluid pushing against the slit in his lungs and trying to escape
into them.
Which meant it was only more important that he get repaired.
It was just then that Dinobot realized something, that foxbot was still
following him.
He looked over his shoulder at Foxfinger with rather a confused expression
on his fanged face, wondering about just what the little bot was up to now.
Obviously he was thankful that he had helped him, but the way that the small
Maximal was always around him was.a little creepy.
Sure, Tavatron was also always around him, but he knew her. This bot, though
he had helped him, was still yet a stranger.
However, as long as he stayed out of his way when things got messy, he
guessed that he wouldn't mind the little guy around.
But the second he annoyed him, he was gone.
Dinobot growled and turned his head back towards the interior of the Maximal
ship, the factor of his repair now more dominant then ever.**
